description: Amazing mac and cheese recipe with a 5:1 cheese-to-pasta ratio — the ultimate tour of Italian greatness in America! This dish combines gouda, cream, ricotta, monterey jack, and fontina cheeses for a creamy, flavorful experience.
author_notes: Sure, the boxed version works, but making it from scratch with fresh cheese and milk is worth it. This recipe is perfect for cozy nights at home or potlucks — always a crowd favorite.
serving_suggestion: Serve hot as a main dish or side, garnished with parsley.
tools: Pot large enough to fit all ingredients

steps.title: Ingredients
steps.details: Gather and measure all ingredients as listed above.

steps.title: Preparation
steps.details: Separate and grate 4 oz of Fontina and 4 oz of Gouda to use later. Slice or crumble hard cheeses for easier melting while boiling the pasta.

steps.title: Boil the Mac
steps.details: Cook macaroni noodles according to box directions, but reduce boiling time by 1 minute. Drain in a colander and return to pot.

steps.title: Adding Ingredients
steps.details: Preheat oven to 350°F. Add butter and evaporated milk to noodles; stir until butter melts. Add all cream, ricotta, and Monterey Jack cheese, plus 8 oz each of Gouda and Fontina. Mix until mostly melted, then season with salt, pepper, and parsley.

steps.title: Swapping Containers
steps.details: Pour the noodle mixture into a 9x13 baking dish. Sprinkle 4 oz each of grated Gouda and Fontina on top. Bake at 350°F for about 30 minutes, or until golden brown. Check every 5 minutes after 30 minutes; total time should not exceed 45 minutes.

steps.title: Enjoy
steps.details: Remove from oven and allow to cool slightly before serving. Garnish with parsley. Serve hot and enjoy!

notes: Smoked Gouda gives the dish a richer flavor, but regular Gouda can be substituted for a milder taste.
This recipe pairs well with a light salad or roasted vegetables.

metadata.source: Homemade adaptation from traditional mac and cheese recipes
